articles.title: Kimjongilia Exhibition Held in China
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Exhibition Held in China 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- An immortal Kimjongilia Exhibition took place at the Famous Flower Garden in Dalian, China on Feb. 16 on the occasion of the February holiday.
 Present there were public figures and masses in Dalian City. 
 After speeches were made, the participants looked round the exhibition presenting a fascinating view with immortal flowers named after a peerlessly great man.
 The director of the board of the Dalian International Trading Co., Ltd. said that he deemed it proud to hold the Kimjongilia exhibition in Dalian at a time when Sino-Korean friendship is growing stronger in new annals.    
 The general manager of a company in Dalian said that Kimjongilia is a flower reflecting the infinite respect of the Korean people for their leader. The general manager of another company in Dalian and that he could not find words to express raptures and beauty of Kimjongilia.    
 The general manager of the garden stressed that he would make positive efforts to widely disseminate the flower.

GNP Urged to Stand Trial of History
articles.content:
GNP Urged to Stand Trial of History 
    Pyongyang, February 26 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a signed commentary castigates a floor leader of the Grand National Party for his reckless remarks in a speech as a representative of a negotiation body at the National Assembly of south Korea on Feb. 21, branding his remarks as one that can be made only by a brazen-faced man, 
 He let loose nonsense that no one opposes the south-north issue, peaceful reunification and independent reunification, and admonished the present government not to use the south-north issue and the reunification issue as a political strategy to remain in power. He even went the length of uttering that the nuclear issue and the human rights issue of the north ought to be settled.    
 His remarks speak for the pro-U.S. conservatives keen to suppress those forces standing for progress and reform and the June 15 reunification forces with the approaching of local autonomous election due in May in south Korea, win election and take the next-term office of power, the commentary says, and goes on:
 What is more serious is that he made virulent outcries about someone's non-existent "human rights issue" while shelving the crimes they have committed by driving the south Koreans into an abyss and ruthlessly abusing their human rights with sycophantic treachery, fascism, corruption and irregularities and political chaos. It admits of no argument that his remarks are aimed to fan up the war hysteria of the U.S. imperialist master keen on a smear campaign for finding the pretext of isolating and stifling the DPRK and incite fratricidal confrontation and war. The traitorous nature of the GNP will never change just as a crow is never the whiter for often washing.
 The GNP clan is making desperate efforts to get rid of their deplorable plight of being thrown away into the garbage of history for turning their back to the times and people's mind-set and attain their dirty greed for power at any cost, but in vain.
 The GNP should not resort to such a silly thing as trying to prolong its remaining days by inciting confrontation and war with fellow countrymen in conspiracy with the outsiders but stand a trial of history by itself as unanimously demanded by the times and the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Mexico 
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's famous work "Let Us Reunify the Country Independently and Peacefully through the Great Unity of the Entire Nation" was brought out in pamphlet by the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea on Feb. 16.
 The work published on Apr. 18, Juche 87 (1998) comprehensively clarifies the principles and tasks for achieving the great unity of the nation including the idea of successfully carrying forward President Kim Il Sung's idea of the great unity of the nation and the idea that the great unity of the nation precisely means national reunification and the idea of achieving it on the principle of national independence under the banner of patriotism and national reunification.

articles.title: Records of History Discovered in S. Korea
Reckless Remarks of GNP Heavyweight Blasted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Reckless Remarks of GNP Heavyweight Blasted in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Ri Pang Ho, chairman of the policy committee of the Grand National Party of south Korea, talked nonsense that people of each country of the world have two countries--their own motherland and the U.S. when addressing what it called "meeting for frustrating the state policy of the present government" on Feb. 20, according to a news report.
 The Reunification Solidarity of south Korea called a press conference in front of the building of the "National Assembly" in Seoul on Feb. 22 at which it termed his remarks sheer nonsense betraying the pro-U.S. sycophantic nature of the GNP.
 Accusing Ri, lawmaker and heavyweight of the biggest opposition party, of unhesitatingly asserting that the U.S. is his country, the Reunification Solidarity declared: This indicates what serious phase the moves of the pro-U.S. sycophantic and traitorous forces have reached.    
 It demanded the GNP, a pro-U.S. traitorous party, disband itself. 
 Angry speeches were made by figures of organizations affiliated to the Reunification Solidarity.    
 The participants shouted slogans such as "Ri Pang Ho, quit the 'National Assembly!'" and "Immediately disorganize the GNP, south Korean branch of the U.S. Republican Party!"

Message of Sympathy to Russian President
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Russian President
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a message of sympathy to Russian President Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin as regards a sudden collapse of a roof in a market in Moscow that claimed dozens of human lives. 
 Expressing deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the bereaved families and victims, the message sincerely hoped that the Russian government would do away with the aftermath of the accident at an early date.

Participants in 3rd Meeting of Pacesetters Have Photo Session
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 3rd meeting of pacesetters of the three-revolution red flag movement had a photo session today.
 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, Jon Pyong Ho, Kim Il Chol and other senior officials of the party, the army and the state.

articles.title: All Koreans Called upon to Force Japan to Pay for Its Crimes Committed against Them
articles.content:
All Koreans Called upon to Force Japan to Pay for Its Crimes Committed against Them
    Pyongyang, February 25 (KCNA)-- A spokesman for the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of the Fatherland issued a statement Saturday 130 years after the Japanese imperialists forced the feudal government of the Ri Dynasty to conclude the criminal "Kanghwa Island Treaty."
 The statement says:
 The Japanese imperialists provoked the "Unyo-maru" incident in September of 1875 and infiltrated seven warships with more than 800 aggressor troops on board into Kanghwa Island in 1876. They threatened and blackmailed the feudal government of the Ri Dynasty, firing guns. Finally on Feb. 27 they fabricated the "Kanghwa Island Treaty" in a coercive way.    
 The treaty contains 12 clauses including those which force Korea to open its ports and grant Japan the right to make a survey of its coastal waters and work out a marine chart. It was, therefore, an illegal one as it was cooked up amid the threat of the Japanese imperialists' armed intervention and under their pressure in disregard of the will and interests of the Korean nation. It was, at the same time, an unequal document of aggression as it paved the way for the Japanese imperialists' aggression of Korea aimed at subjugating Korea politically, economically and militarily.
 Japan is now inciting militarism seized by the same ambition for overseas expansion as in those days when they cooked up the shackling treaty. It is whetting the sword to stage a comeback to Korea, hell bent on the confrontation with the DPRK in support of the U.S. hostile policy toward it.    
 The crimes the Japanese imperialists committed against the Koreans are still fresh in the memory of the Koreans. They will certainly force them to pay for those crimes. The Koreans will never pardon the GNP, a gang of wicked sycophants and traitors  keen on serving the U.S. and Japan in utter disregard of the dignity and interests of the nation, but deal deadly blows at them.
